comment: Professor Dibble was not a bad professor but I would not take her again. She was usually easy to access outside of class through D2L email. When she graded things, she often would hide the grades/assignments so students couldn't see their grades or the feedback to improve for future assignments. The entire class is just A LOT of reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment:
Dibble is awesome! 
I missed a few classes this semester for health reasons, and she wasn't too hard on me. She helped me to get back on track, and didn't shame me for not being able to make it to class. 
Printmaking is hard and there's a lot of work, but she's always happy to help and show you how to do it as many times as you need.

I LOVE DIBBLE! shes one of my all time favorite professors at KSU. Shes literally a second mother to the class and genuinely cares about her students and wants to help! Shes so charismatic and so FUNNY. Please take her if you can. Having her in an in person class is so enjoyable :)

I took this class online during maymester. There were weekly discussions but they aren't all mandatory. You just have to complete four by the end of the semester so you get to pick which ones you want to do. There were tests but they aren't too difficult as long as you study well. There is also a museum artwork project but it isn't hard.

I took this online for maymester and Im happy I did. The class was extremely straightforward and not too time consuming either. The professor was readily available and responded to any questions fairly quick. Most of the test answers are in quizlet as well. Buy the book on chegg for $25 and return it within 2 weeks and theres no charge!

I took art1107 as an online maymester and it was extremely easy. Didn't take up much time. Professor DIbble provides helpful powerpoint presentations and gives you lots of options for modules to complete (you pick 4 out of 11)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: There was a lot of evaluating and discussion in this class. Probably because it was online, but I averaged reading almost everyone's post and replied to around 5-10 people and received A's and B's. She is a tough grader, but lays her class out really well and is very easy to follow along with. 10/10 recommend get ready to read :)))))
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: This is simple do not take her.

An amazing  and inspirational professor. Clear and concise in expectations and assignments. She expects students to act like adults, come to class, and put forth the effort that is required for a BFA. If you can't come to class, a degree in art just isn't for you, regardless of what subject.

Today was the last day of Maymester. She was very helpful, but don't buy the online book/ access code, we never used it. The book maybe helpful for presentations and the final exam. (if you can study from note-taking, the book is not necessary.
Great professor! I had her during the Maymester and she made the class enjoyable. If you take good notes, you won't need the book. Highly recommend.

Fantastic professor, truly an art genius. She has given me a greater appreciation for art especially Ansel Adams. Extremely helpful and knowledgeable and she can convey her knowledge in terms that can be easily understood. Kinda wish I had taken her for an entire semester. One of my favorite classes ever.

I took this as an 8 a.m maymester. Was relativly enjoyable. Don't buy the textbook unless you really have no conception of what art is.This class is mostly history, and elements of art. It was interesting! 1 "Paper" 1 group presentation (She'll give you an outline)a midterm and final (50 mult. choice q's) simple in class assignments for attendance.

Nice, giggly lady. Attendance is mandatory, but she won't freak on you if you are late/don't show up. But she WILL freak if you weren't there for a lecture and ask her a question about it. Do yourself a favor and ask someone else. Take notes on everything (even where things are located!) because she doesn't really like questions.

Printmaking Queen!!! She is an awesome teacher, although you will have to keep her updated on lingo....she thought "bad ass" meant she was awful but she's cool...really!!! You will learn a lot. She expects creativity and hard work but grades fairly. Overall, my favorite class at KSU!! You won't be sorry to take her just show up to class.

I was mad every day of this class. It was not the professor. She has a great sense of humor and is a fair grader. She puts it out there and averages the numbers. It is just a shame what is classified as "ART". It would have been impossible in the regular semester. I took maysession.
Very good teacher. Challenging but the class is very interesting.
This was by far my favorite class at KSU. Professor Dibble is interesting and funny, and there are a lot of hands-on activities. I took this class during Maymester, and I was sad when it was over.
Dibble is awesome! Took her for maymester really enjoyed it. She is also a working artist and has a great sense of humor, which makes the class more interesting.

UNFAIR. Attendance: it doesn't matter how good your work is- if you don't show up and stay the whole time she will count it as an absence.  However, she plays favorites so if youre on her good side you can get away with whatever and make an A.  Complain about your parents getting a divorce and she'll give you an A.
She is a great teacher.  She loves what she is teaching and makes a boring subject more interesting.

AWESOME PROFESSOR. KNOWS HER JOB AND WHAT IT TAKES TO GET THE BEST OUT OF EACH STUDENT! LEARN AND ENJOYED ALL PRINTS AND WOULD TAKE HER CLASSES ALL OVER AGAIN. THANKS FOR BEING AN ABOVE AVERAGE TEACHER.
She is bright, organized and loves her job.  She expects a lot from her students and in return, students get a fun well rounded, fascinating class.  She's exceptional!

I had her for a Maymester and she was very challenging. We worked hard each day but her lectures are thorough and she grades fair. She is very tough though. She has a good sense of humor and knows her subject.
her maymester class was the easiest class of my life. we got out early every day. super easy to make an A!
Alot of fun, if you like to laugh and joke and do your work you will have a great time.
easy going teacher. does not sweat petty things.If you are taking Maymester, this is who you sholud take
Tough but fair,  very interested in her subject and it rubs off on the students.
The criticques are very useful and she helps anyone who asks for it.  She is a fair grader with no restrictions on my own vision. Very organized and I would definatly take her again.

I was so fortunate to have class with this lady. She's funny and kind, extremely knowledgable and helpful. She pushes you to do your best without being mean or judgmental. Take her class when you can.
Great teacher.  Very relaxed class atmosphere.  Always available and helpful.  Lots of fun, highly recomend.
Awesome professor-loves her job!
An excellent artist and professor.
